meanings.definition: To bring into agreement or accord
meanings.sent1: The group worked together to harmonize their ideas for the project.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had to harmonize their schedules to spend more time together.
meanings.sent3: The cats and dogs in the neighborhood somehow managed to harmonize their daily routines.
meanings.sent4: Her calming voice seemed to harmonize conflicting opinions effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the painting harmonize perfectly, creating a beautiful masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To sing or play in harmony
meanings.sent1: The choir members practiced hard to harmonize their voices for the performance.
meanings.sent2: The band members harmonized beautifully during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to harmonize with the music playing in the background.
meanings.sent4: The orchestra instruments harmonized to create a mesmerizing melody.
meanings.sent5: Their voices harmonize like a symphony, filling the room with joy.

meanings.definition: To combine in a pleasing way
meanings.sent1: The flavors in the dish harmonize perfectly, creating a delicious meal.
meanings.sent2: The different scents in the room harmonize to create a relaxing atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The various textures in the fabric harmonize to form a unique design.
meanings.sent4: The elements of the garden harmonize to provide a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent5: The diverse voices in the choir harmonize beautifully, creating a unified sound.
